item.title: TV Script Generation
item.dc:creator: meisam
item.description: In this project, you’ll generate your own Seinfeld TV scripts using RNNs. You’ll be using part of the Seinfeld dataset of scripts from 9 seasons. The Neural Network you’ll build will generate a new ,”fake” TV script, based on patterns it recognizes in this training data. Get the Data The data is already provided for you in ./data/Seinfeld_Scripts.txt and […]
item.content:encoded:
In this project, you’ll generate your own Seinfeld TV scripts using RNNs. You’ll be using part of the Seinfeld dataset of scripts from 9 seasons. The Neural Network you’ll build will generate a new ,”fake” TV script, based on patterns it recognizes in this training data.

Get the Data

The data is already provided for you in ./data/Seinfeld_Scripts.txt and you’re encouraged to open that file and look at the text.

"""
DON'T MODIFY ANYTHING IN THIS CELL
"""
# load in data
import helper
data_dir = './data/Seinfeld_Scripts.txt'
text = helper.load_data(data_dir)
torch.Size([10, 5])
tensor([[  4,   5,   6,   7,   8],
        [ 29,  30,  31,  32,  33],
        [ 21,  22,  23,  24,  25],
        [ 19,  20,  21,  22,  23],
        [ 14,  15,  16,  17,  18],
        [  1,   2,   3,   4,   5],
        [ 33,  34,  35,  36,  37],
        [  2,   3,   4,   5,   6],
        [ 23,  24,  25,  26,  27],
        [  7,   8,   9,  10,  11]])

torch.Size([10])
tensor([  9,  34,  26,  24,  19,   6,  38,   7,  28,  12])
your code here
